article.headline: Cent. Connecticut St. 70, Monmouth, N.J. 65
article.story: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J. (AP) -- Tristan Blackwood scored a game-high 21 points to lead Central Connecticut State to a 70-65 win over Monmouth on Thursday night, clinching their third straight Northeast Conference title. Javier Mojica finished with 18 points and seven rebounds while Obie Nwadike scored 15 points for the Blue Devils (17-10, 14-1). Dejan Delic had 19 points for the Hawks (11-15, 6-8), while Jhamar Youngblood added 15 and Marques Alston finished with 11 points and six rebounds. Central Connecticut was in command for most of the game and held several double-digit leads, but Monmouth tried to rally late as Delic and Youngblood combined for 14 points in the final three minutes. The Hawks cut the lead to 67-62 when Youngblood made two free throws with 19 seconds left, but Mojica then sealed the win by making 3-of-4 free throws down the stretch. Overall, Central Connecticut was 27-of-33 from the free throw line, while Monmouth was 19-of-30. The Hawks also made 44.7 percent of their shots, while the Blue Devils hit 41.3 percent.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
